meanings.definition: An animal that regulates its body temperature primarily by exchanging heat with its surroundings.
meanings.sent1: The lizard is an ectotherm, meaning it relies on the sun to warm up.
meanings.sent2: The snake, an ectotherm, basks in the sun to regulate its body temperature.
meanings.sent3: The ectotherm frog decided to sunbathe on a rock to warm up.
meanings.sent4: Like an ectotherm, the lizard absorbs heat from the ground to stay warm.
meanings.sent5: The ectotherm turtle slowly warms up under the heat of the sun.

meanings.definition: A cold-blooded organism that relies on external sources of heat to regulate its body temperature.
meanings.sent1: The fish, an ectotherm, swims to warmer waters when it gets too cold.
meanings.sent2: An ectotherm like a frog needs to find a sunny spot to warm up.
meanings.sent3: The ectotherm lizard shivered in the cold, wishing for some sunlight.
meanings.sent4: The ectotherm snake slithered closer to a heat source to regulate its body temperature.
meanings.sent5: In the chilly morning, the ectotherm turtle seeks out a sunny patch to warm itself.
